type Comparer = class interface IComparer interface ISerializable

Docs.summary: Compares two objects for equivalence, where string comparisons are case-sensitive.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class is the default implementation of the <xref:System.Collections.IComparer> interface. The <xref:System.Collections.CaseInsensitiveComparer> class is the implementation of the <xref:System.Collections.IComparer> interface that performs case-insensitive string comparisons. <xref:System.Collections.Generic.Comparer%601?displayProperty=nameWithType> is the generic equivalent of this class.
Comparison procedures use the <xref:System.Threading.Thread.CurrentCulture%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> of the current thread unless otherwise specified. String comparisons might have different results depending on the culture. For more information on culture-specific comparisons, see the <xref:System.Globalization> namespace and [Globalization and Localization](~/docs/standard/globalization-localization/index.md).
## Examples The following code example shows how <xref:System.Collections.Comparer.Compare%2A> returns different values depending on the culture associated with the <xref:System.Collections.Comparer>.
[!code-cpp[System.Collections.Comparer#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.Comparer/CPP/comparercultures.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Collections.Comparer#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.Comparer/CS/comparercultures.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.Comparer#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.Comparer/VB/comparercultures.vb#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Comparison procedures use the specified <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo?displayProperty=nameWithType> to determine the sort order and casing rules. String comparisons might have different results depending on the culture. For more information on culture-specific comparisons, see the <xref:System.Globalization> namespace and [Globalization and Localization](~/docs/standard/globalization-localization/index.md).
## Examples The following code example shows how <xref:System.Collections.Comparer.Compare%2A> returns different values depending on the culture associated with the <xref:System.Collections.Comparer>.
[!code-cpp[System.Collections.Comparer#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.Comparer/CPP/comparercultures.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Collections.Comparer#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.Comparer/CS/comparercultures.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.Comparer#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.Comparer/VB/comparercultures.vb#1)]

public: virtual int Compare(System::Object ^ a, System::Object ^ b);
abstract member Compare : obj * obj -> int override this.Compare : obj * obj -> int

Docs.summary: Performs a case-sensitive comparison of two objects of the same type and returns a value indicating whether one is less than, equal to, or greater than the other.
Docs.returns:
A signed integer that indicates the relative values of and , as shown in the following table.
Value
Meaning
Less than zero
is less than .
Zero
equals .
Greater than zero
is greater than .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If `a` implements <xref:System.IComparable>, then `a`. `CompareTo` (`b`) is returned; otherwise, if `b` implements <xref:System.IComparable>, then the negated result of `b`. `CompareTo` (`a`) is returned.
Comparing `null` with any type is allowed and does not generate an exception when using <xref:System.IComparable>. When sorting, `null` is considered to be less than any other object.
String comparisons might have different results depending on the culture. For more information on culture-specific comparisons, see the <xref:System.Globalization> namespace and [Globalization and Localization](~/docs/standard/globalization-localization/index.md).
## Examples The following code example shows how <xref:System.Collections.Comparer.Compare%2A> returns different values depending on the culture associated with the <xref:System.Collections.Comparer>.
[!code-cpp[System.Collections.Comparer#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.Comparer/CPP/comparercultures.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Collections.Comparer#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.Comparer/CS/comparercultures.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.Comparer#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.Comparer/VB/comparercultures.vb#1)]

Docs.exception:
Neither nor implements the interface.
-or-
and are of different types and neither one can handle comparisons with the other.

remarks.format: ## Remarks While the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable.GetObjectData%2A> method is not visible to COM clients by default, inheriting the <xref:System.Collections.Comparer> class can expose it and can cause undesirable behavior in COM clients.

Docs.permission: for the ability to provide serialization services. Associated enumeration: Security action:
requires full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.
